title: david678345
author: david678345
content: Apart from Tradingview do you know any other site where I can see Analysis/Trading Ideas of any technique (order flow, elliot waves, fibobox, chartism etc)?And do you have any tips to know which are the best Trading Analysis/Signals/Trading Ideas from Tradingview ?It seems that anyone can share their Analysis/Signals/Ideas on Tradingview....

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Tradingview is probably the best trading tool where trading analysis and Ideas can be shared in regard to crypto trading out there. There are alternatives to trading view but do not offer a full package of services like TVTechnical analysis is mostly dependent of one's trading style. What could work for me may not work for you, so the best thing is first discovering what kind of trading strategy you want to practice, How much profit are you will to take per trade, what time frames will you use, What's your risk reward ratio etcLooking for trading "signals" is useless if you don't know your strategy.

comments.author: Wind_FURY
comments.body: OP and everyone, I would encourage you to look at "HODL Waves", https://unchained.com/hodlwavesCurrently 68% of the total supply has NOT MOVED for AT LEAST one to two years or above it. About three years ago this number was 59%. "Why" are HODLers increasing, "what" would be the effect of a growing HODLer count on Bitcoin's price when the money printers are turned on again?

comments.author: lombok
comments.body: So far Tradingview is still the number one reference in my opinion. Tradingview provides complete facilities as a website for economic analysis, stocks, forex, commodities, crypto and others.However, if OP wants to try another platform, perhaps OP can visit Investing.comhttps://www.investing.com/Hopefully OP gets what he is looking for.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: Even well-known services and large platforms depend on Tradingview, and the free version provides you with many available tools and options, so you can start using it. You may need in the future to use the paid version when you want to trade more professionally, but you will not find a free version that provides multiple trading options better than Tradingview.You can find better features in some paid versions, but since you want to pay, it is better to pay for something good and worthy.

I have tried different platform before but I immediately stopped using it and I continued using tradingview. And yes, anyone can share their analysis from tradingview but I just want to advice you that don't rely your trades from them especially if they can't provide PnL. Depending your trades from others won't make you profitable for a long time since we don't know how long the lead trader will stay for us. I recommend to join mentorship program then back test and enhanced the strategy that you learned from them. You can also try paper trading and if you can profit and a good win rate in a month, then you can also make it in live trading.

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: Quote from: jeraldskie11 on October 12, 2023, 04:40:20 PM I recommend to join mentorship program then back test and enhanced the strategy that you learned from them. You can also try paper trading and if you can profit and a good win rate in a month, then you can also make it in live trading.Yes, of course, good advice for beginners, but I think that “paper trading” is no longer used these days. There are platforms that allow you to open demo accounts to learn instead. These methods are widely used in Forex.Paper trading or demo accounts have advantages and disadvantages. Through this method, you can learn to trade without real risks, but at the same time, unless you try real trading and test the problems on the ground, you will not gain real experience.Expertise comes through experiences and exposure to profit and loss.
